title.narrative: Power of Voices Fair For All

description.narrative:
- The main focus of the FAIR for ALL programme is to support and strengthen CSOs to play their diverse roles where value chains are transformed from the dominance of primary commodity exports into a situation where there are better linkages with regional and domestic economies, domestic production and enterprise and the rights of communities, producers and workers are protected and enhanced
Supporting CSOs today is more crucial than ever as their space to keep duty bearers accountable and providing innovative ways to transform economies. Activists, human rights defenders and journalists are increasingly harassed, and their organizations increasingly face restrictions and struggle to secure sufficient funding.

The Ghana FAIR for ALL programme has four main focus areas:
1. Strengthen local civil society to collect evidence of rights abuses in cocoa, petroleum and minerals (gold) value chains, 2. Support communities in seeking redress and hold public and private-sector actors to account. 3. Strengthen civil society to advocate towards mining companies, agribusinesses and their suppliers and traders, primarily through multi-stakeholder engagement and new business models, to advance women’s economic empowerment, prevent rights abuses and ensure a living incomes, specifically in Salt and Artisanal gold mining. 4. Promote fiscal and trade regimes that enable better domestic capture of value in value chains. Ensure value is redistributed to support local value chains that are owned and led by domestic enterprises.

The main focus of the FAIR for ALL programme proposal is to support and strengthen CSOs to play their diverse roles; as educators, mobilizers, creators and watchdogs to make trade and value chains FAIR for ALL. Supporting CSOs today is more crucial than ever as their space to keep duty bearers accountable is more and more being compromised. Activists, human rights defenders and journalists are increasingly harassed, and their organizations increasingly face restrictions and struggle to secure sufficient funding.
